metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4927 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Integer signedness error in the get_type_length function inepan/dissectors/packet-btsdp.c in the Bluetooth SDP dissector in Wireshark1.8.x before 1.8.9 and 1.10.x before 1.10.1 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (loop and CPU consumption) via a crafted packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4927` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.6-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
